      • closeQuietly

        public static void closeQuietly(org.cojen.tupl.Database database)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Quietly closes the given Database instance, i.e. closing it without checked exceptions.

        In general, prefer shutdownQuietly(Database) over this method, as it is safer and produces cleaner on-disk representations. This method is reserved for "emergency exit" situations.

        Any exceptions that arise during this process will be re-thrown, wrapped in an IllegalStateException.

        Parameters:
        database - The database to close quietly. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if an exception occurs during the close process.

      • shutdownQuietly

        public static void shutdownQuietly(org.cojen.tupl.Database database)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Quietly shuts down the given Database instance, i.e. shutting it down without checked exceptions.

        Any exceptions that arise during this process will be re-thrown, wrapped in an IllegalStateException.

        Parameters:
        database - The database to shut down quietly. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if an exception occurs during the shutdown process.

      • openDatabase

        public static org.cojen.tupl.Database openDatabase(java.io.File file,
                                                   ChronoDBConfiguration chronoConfig)
        Opens a new Database on the given File, respecting the given ChronoDBConfiguration.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to open the database on. Must not be null.
        chronoConfig - The configuration to use for the new database instance. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The newly created database instance. Never null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if an error occurs while opening the database.

      • openDatabase

        public static org.cojen.tupl.Database openDatabase(java.io.File file,
                                                   long cacheMaxSizeBytes)
        Opens a new Database on the given File with the given maximum cache size (in bytes).
        Parameters:
        file - The file to use for the database instance. Must not be null.
        cacheMaxSizeBytes - The maximum number of bytes to allocate for the cache. Must be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        The newly created database instance. Never null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if an error occurs while opening the database.
